alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 05 at 2:32PM PST until December 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County. * WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 4 to 7 inches every 12 hours can be expected. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
